data.text: How Do You Wash Your Clothes a Long Bike Tour?
Camping - Kit Care When you are touring and camping each night, how do you have a clean set of close for the next day? How to you plan to wash and how many sets of clothes do you carry?
Tide packs n a sink work well
data.author: Tom Middaugh

data.text: No problem at a campsite or B&B. One to wear and one spare is enough for me..
data.author: Christine Roche

data.text: Try bag and dish soap, swish around and let sit for 20 mins, rinse twice and hang to dry
data.author: Liam Terry

data.text: 2 sets of cycling wear. Wash a set every night and dry during the next days ride. Then switch...and an occasional stop at a launddromat.
data.author: Alan Hunter

data.text: Three sets. Wearing one set. A spare dry set and one set drying on the panniers. Don't use shorts with pads, they take too long to dry. Just wash your clothes in the shower with whatever soap you are using.
data.author: Michael Woolaghan

data.text: Debating between two and three sets to have on a long tour. Like having the extra for a spare but it is extra weight. What Iâ€™m wearing gets washed when I take a shower unless there are laundry facilities.
data.author: John Goldman

data.text: I hand wash my clothing and dry either on a line or on top of my tent. I only carry one extra set of clothes besides what I wear.
data.author: Gary Palmer

data.text: I carry one pair of shorts, 4 pairs of socks and 4 shirts. One pair of socks and one shirt I only sleep in. The other 3 pairs of each I rotate through. By the time I cycle through them, the pair Iâ€™ve worn arenâ€™t too bad. Try and do laundry once every few weeks. Also, you should wear padded shorts. Those can be washed every few weeks when you do laundry and left to dry overnight. If you donâ€™t your rump will regret it.

data.text: I carry three sets of clothingâ€¦shorts, jersey, socks, and sweat bandâ€¦and wear one. I have far better things to do every night than laundry. I do a large load of clothes in a machine (with machine drying) every 3 or 4 days.

data.text: Excellent info. When you camp 3-4 days in a row, do you stop at a laundromat to wash or just wear the first set because they are thy dryest? And the stink is almost bearable?

data.author: Dan Hurley

data.text: Carry three pairs of bike shorts. Wash one every night. They dry attached to my bike. Only wash other clothes weekly or when I have access to a washer and drier. Honestly I am more focused on other things than laundry.
data.author: Lukey Nuthmann

data.text: Learn to embrace the grime. Wool stinks less than cotton or synthetics. Bathrooms have sinks to hand wash things. 2 sets of on-bike clothes, one set of off bike stuff.
data.author: James Gasko

data.text: Yes, exactly!
data.author: Lukey Nuthmann

data.text: Two sets of chamois padded shorts, one pair of nylon mtb shorts to wear over, two pair of Merino wool underwear, 3 pair of Merino wool socks, 2 long sleeve rash guard shirts. Wash chamois, socks, rash guard each day before bed. They all dry overnight. Or the second night. I can pin socks to my front rack while riding if they haven't dried
data.author: Andrew Hill

data.text: If you have front panniers.... I get a small plastic bag with some water. A pinch of soap. Put dirty washing in plastic bag. Attach to outer side of front pannier. The constant small movements slowly wash them. After an hour or 2, take out, wring as best you can, and dry on the back panniers. Does not work on rainy days - MDR.

data.text: Do what we have to with this..lol. washed in bathroom sinks. Washed in the shower. Ring out real well so it dries quickly. I've even worn mini pads when I new I'd be short on clean underwear. I Wash twice a day , Morning and night.
